gurmukhi: rGunwQ hrI sIA hyr mnM ]gih bwn islw isq s`ij DnM ]
transliteration: Raghounaath Hariseea Her Manan|| Gad(i) Baan Silaa Sit Sajj(i) Dhanan||
translation: When Ram visualized in his mind about the abduction of Sita, he caught hold of his bow and arrows in his hand and sat down on a white rock.

gurmukhi: chUM Er suDwr inhwr iPry ]iCq aUpr sRI rGurwj igry ]356]
transliteration: Chahoon Or Sudhaar Nihaar Phire|| Chhit Oopar Sriraghuraaj Gire||356||
translation: He saw once again on all the four sides, but ultimately he fell down on the earth in disappontment.356.

gurmukhi: lGubIr auTwie su AOk Bry ]muK poC qbY bcnw aucry ]
transliteration: Laghoubeer Outhaae Su Ank Bhare|| Moukh Pochh Tabai Bachnaa Ouchre||
translation: His younger brother clasped him and raised him and said while cleansing his face :

gurmukhi: ks ADIr pry pRB DIr Dro ]sIA jwie khw iqh soD kro ]357]
transliteration: Kas Adheer Dare Prabh Dheer Daro|| Seea Jaae Kahaa Tih Sodhdaro||357||
translation: “O my Lord ! Do not be impatient, keep your composure. Ruminate on the fact where Sita has gone.?”357.

gurmukhi: auT TwiF Bey iPir BUm igry ]phrykk lau iPr pRwn iPry ]
transliteration: Outh Thaadh(i) Bhae Phir(i) Bhoum Gire|| Pahrekak Lau Phir Praan Phire||
translation: Ram got up but again swooned and came to consciousness again after some time.

gurmukhi: qn cyq sucyq auTy hir XON ]rx mMfl m`iD igrXo Bt jXoN ]358]
transliteration: Tan Chet Souchet Outhe Har(i) Yaoun|| Ran Mandal Maddh(i) Giryo Bhat Jyon||358||
translation: He got up from the earth like a warrior slowly regaining consciousness in the battlefield.358.

transliteration: Chahoon Or Poukaar Bakaar Thake|| Laghu Bhraat Bhae Bahu Bhaant Jhathe||
translation: He grew tired on shouting on all the four sides and experienced great anguish alongwith his younger brother.

gurmukhi: auTkY pun pRwq iesnwn gey ]jl jMq sBY jir Cwir Bey ]359]
transliteration: Outhkai Poun Praat Isnaan Gad|| Jal Jant Sabhai Jar(i) Chdaar(i) Bhae||359||
translation: He went to take bath early in the morning and with the impact of the heat of his agony, all the creatures in the water were burnt down and reduced to ashes.359.

gurmukhi: ibrhI ijh Er su idst DrY ]Pl PUl plws Akws jrY ]
transliteration: Bir-hijih Or Su Dist Ddarai|| Phal Phool Palaas Akaas Darai||
translation: The direction to which Ram saw in his state separation from his beloved, all the flowers and fruit as well us the trees of Palas and the sky burnt with the heat of his vision.

gurmukhi: kr sO Dr jaun CuAMq BeI ]kc bwsn jXoN pk PUt geI ]360]
transliteration: Kar Sau Dhar Jaoun Chuant Bhaee|| Kach Baasan Jyon Pak Phoot Gade||360||
translation: Whenever he touched the earth with his hands, the earth cracked like a brittle vessel with his touch.360.

gurmukhi: ijh BUm QlI pr rwm iPry ]dv jXoN jl pwq plws igry ]
transliteration: Jih Bhoom Thalipar Raam Phire|| Dav Jyon Jal Paat Palaas Gire||
translation: The ground on which Ram rested, the Palas trees (on that ground) were burnt down and reduced to ashes like the grass.

gurmukhi: tut AwsU Awrx nYn JrI ]mno qwq qvw pr bUMd prI ]361]
transliteration: Tout Aasoo Aaran Nain Jdaree|| Mano Taat Tavaa Par Boond Daree||361||
translation: The continuous flow of his tears evaporated on falling down on the earth like the drops of water falling on the got plate.361.

gurmukhi: qn rwGv Byt smIr jrI ]qj DIr srovr swNJ durI ]
transliteration: Tan Raaghav Bhet Sameer Daree|| Taj Dheer Darovar Maanjh Duree||
translation: Even the cold mind burnt when it touched his body and controlling its coolness and forsaking its patience, it merged into the pool of water;
